intro: Gymnostachyum triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered gymnostachyum, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Gymnostachyum triflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
